text: The new pope knows that his task is to make the light of Christ shine before men and women of world - not his own light, but that of Christ.
author: Pope Benedict XVI

text: I heard the old, old, men say 'all that's beautiful drifts away, like the waters.'
author: William Butler Yeats

text: A little group of willful men, representing no opinion but their own, have rendered the great government of the United States helpless and contemptible.
author: Woodrow Wilson

text: The real use of gunpowder is to make all men tall.
author: Thomas Carlyle

text: These people are very unskilled in arms... with 50 men they could all be subjected and made to do all that one wished.
author: Christopher Columbus
